Overview.Title: Tangram Task Qualification Tutorial
Overview.FormattedContent:
This is a qualification tutorial for the tangram annotation task. This tutorial entails watching a short video (< 2 minutes), reading a few examples, and completing a short quiz (3 multiple choice questions). You will be given 1 hour for the qualification test, but it usually only takes 5-6 minutes.

In the tangram task, you will see a simple but abstract shape. Different people see different things when they look at the shape and we are interested in what you see. After you describe what the shape looks like, you will describe the parts of that shape. A single assignment should take approximately 30 seconds.

Payment
We plan to pay USD$0.14 for completing each tangram task.
In the main tangram task, we plan to release HITs regularly over the next few weeks, and you will be allowed to accept as many as you would like.

Contact
If you have any questions, feel free to reach out at lic.cs.cornell@gmail.com

Thank you!

Consent
This is part of a Cornell University research study, about the naming of objects and their parts. The participation is anonymous and voluntary. Participants can choose to stop participating at any time. By completing the qualifier and any subsequent related tasks, you [the participant] are consenting to participate in the research. This research is led by Yoav Artzi (contact email: lic.cs.cornell@gmail.com).
